title: Johaar Mosaval, S. African ballet star who challenged apartheid, dies at 95
description: Mr. Mosaval rose to became a principal dancer in Britain’s Royal Ballet after facing discrimination at home because of his heritage and skin color.

title: West African bloc says it is ready for ‘D-day’ intervention in Niger
description: ECOWAS is ready to invade Niger, to restore democracy after last month’s coup, the bloc said Friday, though there is still time for dialogue.

title: Once deemed unladylike, women’s soccer grabs center stage in England
description: Soccer is England’s national sport and the hunger for the men to win a significant trophy is ever palpable. And yet, it’s the women who are getting the results.

title: A presidential candidate was assassinated. His rivals are trying to stay alive.
description: Ecuador wasn’t prepared for the assassination of a presidential candidate. There are no rules or protocol for protecting them.

title: Neonatal nurse found guilty of murdering 7 babies in her care
description: Lucy Letby was accused of poisoning babies in her care at a Chester, England, hospital with insulin, injecting air into their veins or overfeeding them with milk.

title: Scramble for Yellowknife flights as wildfire evacuation deadline nears
description: Canada is facing over 1,000 active wildfires, with Yellowknife residents asked to evacuate by noon Friday, and a state of emergency in Kelowna, British Colombia.

title: Wildfire forces entire capital of Canada’s Northwest Territories to evacuate
description: All 20,000 residents of Yellowknife were ordered to flee their homes as a massive blaze that has already burned 400,000 acres approached their city.

title: China’s property market is too big to fail, but will Beijing save it?
description: Pressure is mounting on financial authorities to intervene to shore up China’s gargantuan property market, but so far they’ve shied away from bold action.

title: Germany’s far-right party is more popular than ever — and more extreme
description: Record poll numbers for the far-right Alternative for Germany Party come at a time when analysts say it's more radical than ever.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv’s counteroffensive won’t reach Russian-occupied city of Melitopol, U.S. predicts
description: Severing the land bridge connecting Russia to the Crimean peninsulas is one of the key goals in the ongoing counteroffensive.

title: Russia recruited operatives online to target weapons crossing Poland
description: Russian intelligence recruited Ukrainian refugees in Poland to sabotage weapons shipments to Kyiv, but the effort become another embarassment for the Kremlin.

title: Armenians see a new genocide taking place. Azerbaijan sees propaganda.
description: In an ethnic Armenian enclave in Nagorno-Karabakh, tens of thousands are enduring what locals and international experts describe as a blockade at the hands of Azerbaijan. Azerbaijan’s U.N. envoy called those “groundless allegations.”

title: Chinese property giant Evergrande files for Chapter 15 bankruptcy
description: The heavily indebted company has become an emblem of China’s real estate crisis. It is seeking protection from creditors while it makes efforts to restructure.

title: Delano Lewis, who led NPR during divisive budget fights, dies at 84
description: In a wide-ranging career, Mr. Lewis served as U.S. ambassador to South Africa, a telecoms executive and confidant to D.C. Mayor Marion Barry.
